content.description: Nice shady afternoon route so you can dress for success in this wide hands to squeeze chimney. Protection is way in the back of the chimney but you need a long sling to squirm outside instead.
content.location: From South side of Hippy Dome formation walk to the huge boulders below Hard Days Work. Make your way up slabs and shrubs to the largest boulder that has an East face. The 5.8 crack is the first route you see and this one is just right of the same giant boulder.

climbs.name: Vanilla Pudding
climbs.fa: Manuel Rangel, Joe Garcia, Stan Pak

content.description: Starting the route is probably the crux. At the bottom begin on left side of block, difficult moves get you onto the base of the squeeze chimney.
content.protection: I use two pieces but could have had three. Not much on the top half unless you bring a big bro.
content.location: On the left half of the south face of the complex is a ten foot block below an obvious squeeze chimney. Begin on left side.

content.description: Climb the flake system passing a single bolt in the middle and finishing at the anchor for Hard Day's Work. Probably best to belay from the top due to a sharp edge just before the anchor.Don't know the name or FA for this so if you do let me know and I'll update it.
content.protection: Couple of .3 and .4, single .5-1, draws and some small nuts is more than enough.
content.location: The obvious flake system to the left of Hard Day's Work.

content.description: The hardest part was the first pitch, a horizontal adventure. The second pitch was hard too though.
content.location: Located in the rock (approach via east side) is a long horizontal crack leading to the base of the leaning squeeze above. Dark start and sunny upper part.

climbs.name: Pinky
climbs.fa: Carlos Villanueva and Manuel Rangel, January 2022

content.description: Technical crack with a small layback section followed by an off width section that is easy if you pay attention to footholds.
content.protection: Hand pieces up to #5. One bolt anchor (second bolt coming soon)
content.location: In the Pac-Man area of the hippy dome. From Hard Day’s Work, You should be able to see the Pac-Man directly uphill and to the left. The Pac-Man is a giant round boulder in the shape of a Pac-Man wedged in between 2 walls. Blinky is the route directly north of Pac-Man, Inky is the route that finishes on top of Pac-Man, and Pinky is to the right and around the corner of Pac-Man.

content.description: Starting is tough then it gets harder. Then you finish on a widening crack. I don't remember who put the bolt in.
content.protection: A few cams; big bro if you have one. A lone bolt part way up.
content.location: On the NE side of the dome, an alcove that faces east has the obvious line with a bolt on left side of crack.

climbs.name: Mannventure
climbs.fa: Joe Garcia, Manny Rangel, Stan Pak

content.description: Near the center of the line it gets steeper and the crack goes from fist to wider a bit.
content.protection: single rack cams, doubles #3,#4, slings etc.
content.location: Found on left side of south face of the domes. Approach via west side of formation, go past the domes and head back. This is left of the Vanilla Pudding squeeze.

content.description: Getting to the route is tricky. First, get to the base of the 5.8 Hand Crack. From here look east and climb the bulge to the top of the rock formation (next time I come I will leave a short rope to make it easier to get to the top). At the top, you will find 2 bolts that you will use to rappel down to the start of the route. Potentially you could walk up to the base of the route but I would not recommend that as the approach will likely suck, plus you want to do the beautiful 5.8 Hand crack anyway. Rap directly east onto a boulder at the base of the route and start climbing from there. The route has 2 cruxes: the first and last moves. In between, you get a nice and easy off-width crack.
content.protection: 0.5-1 cams for the beginning. #3-5 size cams for the offwidth section. One bolt for the slippery finale.
content.location: Directly below and east of the 5.8 hand crack

climbs.name: Inky
climbs.fa: Carlos Villanueva and Manuel Rangel, January 2022

content.description: Overhanging tight hands that widens at the top. Cruxy move at the start.
content.location: In the Pac-Man area of the hippy dome. From Hard Day’s Work, You should be able to see the Pac-Man directly uphill and to the left. The Pac-Man is a giant round boulder in the shape of a Pac-Man wedged in between 2 walls. Blinky is the route directly north of Pac-Man, Inky is the route that finishes on top of Pac-Man, and Pinky is to the right and around the corner of Pac-Man.

content.description: A steep and leaning offwidth splitting a boulder that involves some trickery to get up.  A single bolt anchor waits up top.
content.location: Bottom of the hill and almost directly below "Hard days Work"

content.description: Getting off the ground is hard for me. Then it eases off near the wider hands section.
content.protection: Single cams from .75 to #4 camalot, slings
content.location: Located east of the south face a few large boulders over, look for a square boulder on top. It's brushy and loaded with boulders around it.

content.description: The crux is the start. After that is sustained at the grade with good pro.
content.protection: I used 0.5 to 3 inch cams. Rappel chains at the top.
content.location: Best to see attached pictures. The Hippy dome is a maze.

climbs.name: Blinky
climbs.fa: Carlos Villanueva, Kenn Noble, Betty Gonzales, Jacob Gonzales, Manuel Rangel, January 2021

content.description: Great hand crack that widens a little towards the top. You will only wish it was longer.
content.protection: Mostly #3, but you can get a #2 and a #4 in a couple of places.
content.location: In the Pac-Man area of the hippy dome. From Hard Day’s Work, You should be able to see the Pac-Man directly uphill and to the left. The Pac-Man is a giant round boulder in the shape of a Pac-Man wedged in between 2 walls. Blinky is the route directly north of Pac-Man, Inky is the route that finishes on top of Pac-Man, and Pinky is to the right and around the corner of Pac-Man.

content.description: There is a steep section at the start to get going, but then it backs off a touch for the rest of the climb.  I thought it was sustained for the grade varying between bomber hands and tight hands mostly.  Clean rock and relatively shady in the afternoon.
content.location: This climb is located on the East side of the formation. This side is a bit of a maze and I have not found a "wife approved" approach yet.  See the pictures for location.

content.description: This complex of boulders and domes sits on top of a hill just southeast of the end of the road. Make your way past the hilltop and walk back to the south end of the formation for most climbs. A really cool climb is located on the NE side, Mike's Crack.
